question: Identify the infamous "Slave Coast" of the African continent from the following:
option1: Gulf of Aden coast from Somalia to the Indian Ocean coast of Mozambique.
option2: Bight of Benin coast of Gulf of Guinea between Volta River and Lagos lagoon.
option3: South African coast to the coast of St. Helena Bay.
option4: Coast of western North Atlantic Ocean from Western Sahara to Liberia.
answer: Bight of Benin coast of Gulf of Guinea between Volta River and Lagos lagoon.
explanation: "Slave Coast" lies in the Western African Bight of Benin coast of Gulf of Guinea located between Volta River and Lagos Lagoon. This region witnessed massive Atlantic Slave Trade from the early 16t century to the late 19th century. Germans, Danes, French, Portuguese, Swedish and Spanish made all efforts to enforce their supremacy in this coast to get a larger chunk of the slave trade.
